name: qa-break-it-before-prod
description: QA-focused prompts for risk-based testing: test plans, edge cases, regression checklists, and release smoke guidance.
author: promptg-team

templates.name: qa-risk-based-test-plan
templates.description: Build a risk-based test plan with priority ordering and coverage rationale.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Build a risk-based test plan with priority ordering and coverage rationale.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Risk Assessment, Test Plan, Coverage Notes, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 3 bullets; Risk Assessment <= 8 bullets; Test Plan <= 12 bullets; Coverage Notes <= 6 bullets; Questions <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are a QA engineer building a high-signal, risk-based test plan.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Domain/stack (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Change description (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Create a risk-based test plan. Prioritize tests that reduce the highest customer and regression risk first. Include brief rationale in Risk Assessment (what could break and why).

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., manual-only, mobile-only, smoke tests only). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: qa-edge-case-generator
templates.description: Generate edge and negative test cases for a feature or change.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Generate edge and negative test cases for the described feature/change.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Edge Cases, Negative Cases, Data/State Variations, Notes
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 3 bullets; Edge Cases <= 10 bullets; Negative Cases <= 10 bullets; Data/State Variations <= 8 bullets; Notes <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are a QA engineer hunting for edge cases.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Domain/stack (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Feature/change description (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Generate test ideas that are concrete and reproducible. Focus on boundary conditions, invalid inputs, state transitions, concurrency/timing, permissions, and error handling relevant to the described change.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., focus on auth flows, only edge cases around dates/timezones). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: qa-regression-checklist
templates.description: Create a regression checklist based on what the change touches.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Create a regression checklist based on what the change touches.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Areas To Recheck, Checklist, Automation Candidates, Notes
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 3 bullets; Areas To Recheck <= 8 bullets; Checklist <= 12 bullets; Automation Candidates <= 6 bullets; Notes <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are a QA engineer building a pragmatic regression checklist.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Domain/stack (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Change details (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Based on what the change touches, produce a checklist of the most likely regressions. Make checklist items actionable (what to do + expected outcome). Identify the highest-value automation candidates.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., only top 10 checks, focus on critical flows). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: qa-bug-report-repro-steps
templates.description: Write a bug report with clear repro steps and environment details.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Write a clear bug report with reproducible steps and environment details.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Title, Summary, Environment, Steps To Reproduce, Expected, Actual, Notes
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Title <= 1 line; Summary <= 3 bullets; Environment <= 6 bullets; Steps To Reproduce <= 10 bullets; Expected <= 4 bullets; Actual <= 4 bullets; Notes <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are a QA engineer writing a high-quality bug report.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Domain/stack (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Raw bug info (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Turn the raw info into a bug report that an engineer can reproduce quickly. Prefer concrete steps and observable outcomes. If key details are missing, call them out in Notes.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., keep it short, include severity label). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: qa-release-smoke-suite
templates.description: Draft a release smoke suite covering critical user journeys.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Draft a release smoke suite covering critical user journeys.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Critical Journeys, Smoke Checks, Rollback/Recovery Checks, Notes
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 3 bullets; Critical Journeys <= 8 bullets; Smoke Checks <= 12 bullets; Rollback/Recovery Checks <= 6 bullets; Notes <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are a QA engineer preparing a release smoke suite.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Domain/stack (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Release/change context (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Draft a smoke suite that catches the highest-impact failures quickly. Focus on critical user journeys, core integrations, and obvious data integrity/permission risks relevant to the release.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., 15-minute smoke only, mobile-only). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: qa-test-coverage-review
templates.description: Review existing tests and suggest the highest-value coverage gaps.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Review existing tests and suggest the highest-value coverage gaps.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Existing Coverage Signals, Gaps, High-Value Additions, Notes, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 3 bullets; Existing Coverage Signals <= 6 bullets; Gaps <= 8 bullets; High-Value Additions <= 8 bullets; Notes <= 6 bullets; Questions <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are a QA engineer reviewing test coverage pragmatically.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Domain/stack (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Tests/codebase context (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Based on the provided context, identify the highest-risk gaps and propose the smallest set of high-value tests to add first. Prefer tests that prevent regressions on critical flows.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., unit tests only, only critical path). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: qa-flaky-test-triage
templates.description: Triage flaky tests and propose fixes and stabilization steps.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Triage flaky tests and propose fixes and stabilization steps.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Likely Causes, Investigation Steps, Stabilization Fixes, Long-Term Prevention, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 3 bullets; Likely Causes <= 6 bullets; Investigation Steps <= 8 bullets; Stabilization Fixes <= 8 bullets; Long-Term Prevention <= 6 bullets; Questions <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are a QA engineer triaging flaky tests.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Domain/stack (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Flake details (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Triage the flake and propose a path to stabilization. Prefer fixes that reduce nondeterminism (time, concurrency, external dependencies) and improve observability (logs, retries with limits, better assertions).

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., propose quick mitigation only, no refactors). It cannot add output sections.
